adjectives.description: coronary (comparative more coronary, superlative most coronary)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Pertaining to a crown or garland.
examples: The coronary thorns did not only express the scorn of the imposers by that figure into which they were contrived, but did also pierce his tender and sacred temples to a multiplicity of pains, by their numerous acuminations.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Encircling something (like a crown), especially with regard to the arteries or veins of the heart.
(anatomy, medicine) Any of the coronary vessels; a coronary artery or coronary vein.

examples: Manny had a coronary last week, followed by a triple bypass.

entries.meaning: A small bone in the foot of a horse.
